meanings.definition: To strike forcefully or with a heavy blow.
meanings.sent1: He was whacking the nail into the wood with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: The lumberjack was whacking at the tree with his axe.
meanings.sent3: The chef was whacking the dough to make it flat for the pizza.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm was whacking the windows with rain and wind.
meanings.sent5: The boxer was whacking his opponent with powerful punches.

meanings.definition: Very large or considerable in size or amount.
meanings.sent1: The elephant was a whacking animal in the zoo.
meanings.sent2: She carried a whacking backpack full of books to school.
meanings.sent3: The cake was a whacking size, enough to feed the whole party.
meanings.sent4: The mountain was a whacking obstacle in their hiking journey.
meanings.sent5: The whale was a whacking creature in the vast ocean.

meanings.definition: A sound made by a heavy blow.
meanings.sent1: The whacking of the hammer echoed through the workshop.
meanings.sent2: The whacking of the waves against the shore was soothing.
meanings.sent3: The whacking of the drumsticks brought rhythm to the music.
meanings.sent4: The whacking of the tennis ball against the wall signaled practice.
meanings.sent5: The whacking of the gavel silenced the courtroom.
